<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Lion Blade Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=917) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [World Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=6) pg. 131 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Lion Blade](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=22)

**Prerequisites**
member of the Lion Blades; Trained in [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12)

**Access**
You are from Taldor.

</column>

---

Your lion blade spy training helps you conceal yourself and your identity. You become trained in your choice of [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) or [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) and in Espionage [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8); if you were already trained, you become an expert instead. You never take circumstance penalties for attempting to take a disguise of a different ancestry, age, and so on, as long as the disguised form is appropriate for your size.

**Special** You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the Lion Blade archetype.

<title level="2">Lion Blade Dedication leads to...</title>
[Expeditious Advance](/Feats.aspx?ID=920), [Flicker](/Feats.aspx?ID=922), [Lost in the Crowd](/Feats.aspx?ID=918), [Spy's Countermeasures](/Feats.aspx?ID=921)

prerequisite: member of the Lion Blades; Trained in Performance
